title: How to choose a programming language to learn
description: We are surrounded by hundreds of programming languages, but you can’t learn all of them. In this article, I am going to explain a few simple points to consider while choosing your next programming language to learn.

title: A basic introduction to Canvas API to draw 2D/3D graphics on Web
description: In this article, we are going look at the basics of Canvas Web API provided by the browser to draw 2D/3D graphics natively on the web.

title: How to create an executable (.exe) file from JavaScript code (using Node.js)
description: In this lesson, we are going to learn how to create a .exe binary executable file from JavaScript code. This is possible with the help of Node.js runtime and some third-party tools.

title: Integrating TypeScript with Webpack
description: In this lesson, we are going to learn how to compile a TypeScript project using Webpack. This setup becomes necessary if you want to bundle TypeScript containing ES6 or the CommonJS module system imports and exports.

title: What’s new in JavaScript 2020?
description: There are some new ECMAScript proposals that have landed in the “stage 4” of the TC39 proposal track. Let’s have a quick look at these features and experiment with them.

title: Anatomy of Modules in Go
description: Modules are a new way to manage dependencies of your Go project. Modules enable us to incorporate different versions of the same dependency without breaking the application.

title: How to set up GitHub workflows and create GitHub Actions using Docker
description: In this article, we are going to learn how a GitHub workflow works and how to set them up. Also, we are going to create customized GitHub actions with ease using Docker.

title: Introduction to Character Encoding
description: In this article, we will learn about popular character encoding schemes and how we can use them in real life.

title: A brief overview of the TCP/IP model, SSL/TLS/HTTPS protocols and SSL certificates
description: In this article, we will learn about how web encryption and web security works based on the SSL/TLS protocol. We will also go through the anatomy of SSL certificates and how to generate a self-signed certificate for your own use.
